intro: Desmoncus ataxacanthus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved desmoncus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight serration along the edges. It is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
